headline: Another Face
description: A mythic encounter with beauty, drought, and danger — a face both familiar and unknown, met with refusal and turning away. The Lightning Mask Phase captures the refusal of illusion and the gaze beyond.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio
whyItMatters: This piece records the haunting recognition of beauty and danger in a false guise. It shows the strength of refusal, the moment of turning away, and the lightning of recognition without surrender to illusion.

motifMap.meaning: Beauty and danger entangled; mythic siren figure
Witness and refusal, torn between recognition and denial
The sharp flash of prescience; recognition of false reunion

articleExcerpt:
And there she was—
all done up, another face.
Beauty and drought,
the flower in my stories,
the danger in my dreams.

The tingle of prescience—
she might be here.
And there she was,
eyes like a lightning strike.

But she was no one I knew.
Though she was my wife—
for a little while longer—
I turned my gaze to the horizon,
and went on my way.

Because I never knew her.
sourceFragments: Aleksandr’s poem 'Another Face' posted to Wanderer’s Burn on September 14, 2025.

associatedMedia.description: Painting of a red-haired woman and a man in a white shirt, embodying beauty, danger, and refusal.
